channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Texan Stoicism Provides Comfort, and Excuses, After the Flood
item.description: Texans often draw on the idea of their own self-reliance during times of adversity. Gov. Greg Abbott has used it to deflect tough questions.

item.title: Bluffs and Bluster Aside, Trump’s Tariffs Are Here to Stay
item.description: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.

item.title: Trump’s Willingness to Arm Ukraine Puts Him Closer to Biden Approach
item.description: President Trump is expected this week to formalize a new plan to sell American weapons to European allies, who would pass them onto Kyiv.

item.title: Trump says he’s ‘giving serious consideration to taking away’ Rosie O’Donnell’s U.S. citizenship
item.description: That's despite a decades-old Supreme Court ruling that expressly prohibits such an action by the government.

item.title: China exports surge 5.8% in June as business rush through orders during U.S. tariff reprieve
item.description: Exports to the United States fell 16%, but that was less than half the 34.5% drop seen in May.

item.title: Panasonic’s Megan Myungwon Lee wants half her EV battery supply chain inside North America by 2030
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Several Killed in Fire at Massachusetts Assisted Living Facility
item.description: The fire broke out on Sunday in the city of Fall River, a state official said. The exact number of victims was unclear.

item.title: Nursing homes struggle to recruit staff as Trump attacks sources of immigrant workers: ‘We feel completely beat up right now’
item.description: Facilities for older adults and disabled people fear even more dramatic impacts are ahead as pipelines of potential workers slow to a trickle with an ...

item.title: OCBC’s next CEO shows the Singaporean bank is still betting on ASEAN-China ties for growth
item.description: OCBC’s CEO-to-be comes with a wealth of China experience, including a five-year stint leading DBS’s institutional banking business in China.

item.title: In His Own Words: How Trump Changed His Tone on Putin and the War in Ukraine
item.description: After years of lavishing praise on the Russian leader, President Trump abruptly changed his posture amid mounting frustration with the lack of progres...

item.title: Trump Is Expected to Announce New Weapons Pipeline for Ukraine
item.description: Under the plan, other NATO countries would buy U.S.-made arms, then give them to Ukraine to defend itself against Russia. NATO’s secretary general was...

item.title: Public Broadcasters Brace for Vote on Sharp Funding Cut
item.description: At the urging of President Trump, Congress is expected to vote this week on whether to cut $500 million per year for public radio and TV stations.

item.title: Chinese University Expels Woman for ‘Improper Contact’ With a Foreigner
item.description: The university published the student’s full name and said her behavior had “damaged national dignity.” The move prompted an online debate and accusati...

item.title: Bluffs and Bluster Aside, Trump’s Tariffs Are Here to Stay
item.description: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.

item.title: Trump’s Willingness to Arm Ukraine Puts Him Closer to Biden Approach
item.description: President Trump is expected this week to formalize a new plan to sell American weapons to European allies, who would pass them onto Kyiv.
